etymology.description: 豆 (bean) + 豉 (fermented beans/condiment) = fermented soybeans (seasoning).
etymology.interpretation: Refers to fermented soybeans used as a savory seasoning, especially the black, salted kind. 豉 historically denotes fermented grain or beans, so adding 豆 specifies soy.

parts.english: fermented soybeans; fermented grain; condiment; relish

examples.chinese: 我喜欢用豆豉炒苦瓜(我喜歡用豆豉炒苦瓜)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān yòng dòuchǐ chǎo kǔguā.
examples.english: I like to stir-fry bitter melon with douchi.

examples.chinese: 清蒸鱼时(清蒸魚時)，加一点豆豉更提味(加一點豆豉更提味)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngzhēng yú shí, jiā yīdiǎn dòuchǐ gèng tíwèi.
examples.english: When steaming fish, adding a little douchi enhances the flavor.

examples.chinese: 这道豆豉鸡很下饭(這道豆豉雞很下飯)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào dòuchǐ jī hěn xiàfàn.
examples.english: This douchi chicken goes great with rice.
